reviews.text: Food is a bit expensive, but very good.  I ordered the scallops and shrimp fettucine and this was great.  2 people ordered the cavatelli with chicken and 1 other ordered the jambalaya.  All were not bad but nothing above what I've had elsewhere.  My gumbo was great.  Just fyi, you only get 2 scallops with the scallop appetizer - for $20.  Calamari rings were nice and thick.  I'd rather have plain marinara to dip in.  3 of us had a mixed drink.  With tip, our total for 4 was $290.  We sat in the patio on a hot day and even though it was covered and fans were going, there was not much air movement, surprisingly. So a little warm.  Also ambience of the parking lot is nothing special. Basically overlooks parking.  Server very nice but was slow. I live about 35 min away and if I'm in the area, will likely come back

Everything was very good, the atmosphere was perfect for a simple date night. We got the garlic spread, garlic parmesan wings, and oysters.
For dinner my boyfriend had the jambalaya and I had the Codia.

Glad we gave Russo‚Äôs another chance after my wife did not have a great experience here a few years back. We‚Äôve been back three times in the last year  and each time Russo‚Äôs has provided an enjoyable dining experience for us.

My wife and I like this restaurant for its food, delicious cocktails and good service. It's been a great ‚Äòre-discovery‚Äô for us and it has become our go-to restaurant when we want to have a really special dining experience.

This isn't a place where you can just show up and find a table‚Äîit's popular, so reservations are really necessary to guarantee a spot to eat.

The dishes we‚Äôve had here are delicious and in just-right proportions. We've come here with just ourselves and once with friends and have not been disappointed.

Our servers have also been an important part of our dining experience at Russo's. They've all been personable and attentive.

Russo's has two places to dine that offer two completely different experiences: the main dining room and the Bacchus Room. The main dining room has a combination of booths and tables in a carpeted area, making for a quieter atmosphere. The Bacchus Room is more of a casual sports bar type of area. It is a simple area with bare floors, standard tables, TVs with sports games on them and a bar, but also with garage doors that can open up to a patio in nicer weather.

Both areas now have the same menu. The most recent time we came we had to sit in the Bacchus Room because the main dining room was full and we could only get reservations for Bacchus. We still had excellent service and a tasty meal.

Finally, we've really enjoyed the cocktails here, especially the martinis. Great espresso martini and the sour apple has become one of my favorites.

Be prepared to pay a little more to eat here, as we have generally found entrees to be around $35 on up and cocktails were about $12, BUT...so worth it!

We look forward to returning.

Everything was excellent starting with the roasted garlic and crusty bread.  Homemade cavetelli and meatballs.  The marinated pork chop was so tender and perfectly seasoned.  Oysters were great.  Service was also very good.  Can't wait to go back!

Wonderful wonderful wonderful. Great food from their oysters to their pastas and Cajun. Left feeling satisfied and wanting to return soon. The atmosphere was inviting and lively. The open kitchen was a spectacular view and the staff was quick and friendly. It‚Äôs off the beaten path slightly but once you‚Äôre inside you feel emerged into the Cajun smells and ready to dig into some amazing meals.

editorial_summary.overview: Upbeat restaurant serving Italian & Creole fare, such as pasta with crawfish sauce & jambalaya.

issues: Mobile performance data unavailable - API configuration required

Test website on mobile devices manually

recentReviews.text: Went for dinner 9/13, sat at the bar in the rear of the restaurant. I ordered 2 appetizers and my wife ordered the Navajo Taco at $36.  She ordered the steak well done. When it arrived, it was medium rare. When my wife commented, the steak was not cooked properly, our server, Darien F.,  took the steak and put it underneath the bar counter. No apology, nothing.  Paid the $120.62 bill, left her a $25. Tip, never to return.
Food is always great. Quality ingredients and prepared perfectly.
Great dinning experience. Top notch food and entertainment on the weekends  .
I didn‚Äôt expect much but my dinner was lovely, there was live music and my shrimp scampi was absolutely delicious!

Food is a bit expensive, but very good.  I ordered the scallops and shrimp fettucine and this was great.  2 people ordered the cavatelli with chicken and 1 other ordered the jambalaya.  All were not bad but nothing above what I've had elsewhere.  My gumbo was great.  Just fyi, you only get 2 scallops with the scallop appetizer - for $20.  Calamari rings were nice and thick.  I'd rather have plain marinara to dip in.  3 of us had a mixed drink.  With tip, our total for 4 was $290.  We sat in the patio on a hot day and even though it was covered and fans were going, there was not much air movement, surprisingly. So a little warm.  Also ambience of the parking lot is nothing special. Basically overlooks parking.  Server very nice but was slow. I live about 35 min away and if I'm in the area, will likely come back

They advertised special drink prices on Wednesday. There were none. They advertised live music on Wednesday. There was none. They advertised grilled oysters Wednesday. None. My husband ordered etoufe with oysters and shrimp. There were no oysters. For $36 it was an appetizer sized portion.

detailedReviews.author: Dave Siemon
detailedReviews.text: Went for dinner 9/13, sat at the bar in the rear of the restaurant. I ordered 2 appetizers and my wife ordered the Navajo Taco at $36.  She ordered the steak well done. When it arrived, it was medium rare. When my wife commented, the steak was not cooked properly, our server, Darien F.,  took the steak and put it underneath the bar counter. No apology, nothing.  Paid the $120.62 bill, left her a $25. Tip, never to return.

detailedReviews.text: Food is always great. Quality ingredients and prepared perfectly.

detailedReviews.text: Great dinning experience. Top notch food and entertainment on the weekends  .

detailedReviews.author: O G
detailedReviews.text: I didn‚Äôt expect much but my dinner was lovely, there was live music and my shrimp scampi was absolutely delicious!

My husband ordered etoufe with oysters and shrimp. There were no oysters. For $36 it was an appetizer sized portion.

detailedReviews.author: d davis
detailedReviews.text: jambalaya fabulous

detailedReviews.author: Robbert Swordcutter
detailedReviews.text: Went in for lunch. Our server was extremely courteous and knowledgeable.

detailedReviews.author: mike simonelli
detailedReviews.text: Everything was excellent starting with the roasted garlic and crusty bread.  Homemade cavetelli and meatballs.  The marinated pork chop was so tender and perfectly seasoned.  Oysters were great.  Service was also very good.  Can't wait to go back!

detailedReviews.author: Ann Wood
detailedReviews.text: It's pricey and nothing special

detailedReviews.author: Christy Allen
detailedReviews.text: Fabulous pork chop!  Highly recommend

detailedReviews.author: Demos Ioannou
detailedReviews.text: This place is a Hidden Gem - the food is outrageously good, and the menus are different every time I go in there.

detailedReviews.author: Rajat Maheshwari
detailedReviews.text: Jambalaya was very flavourful. Music was good. Kids portions are generous.

detailedReviews.author: Steph Moore
detailedReviews.text: We enjoyed the food, patio had a singer for entertainment.  Service was subpar for the price tag tho, very slow!

detailedReviews.author: Omar Little
detailedReviews.text:
Food is absolutely delicious. Our sever was friendly and well trained.

Tough spot to have a 5 star atmosphere but we had fun.

detailedReviews.author: David Geig
detailedReviews.text: Tried to come in through the back entrance to pickup my order and couldn‚Äôt get in. Had to take a super long detour. Unblock your stupid driveway

detailedReviews.author: Suzie Stanley
detailedReviews.text: The food here is always great! We sat at the bar and the bartender was very nice, talkative, great sence of humor. Wonderful evening for a girls night out

detailedReviews.author: Dave O'Connor
detailedReviews.text: Amazing food. And we had an excellent waitress which made the experience even better. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

detailedReviews.author: Chelsea Caspersen
detailedReviews.text: The best !

detailedReviews.author: Brian Lavelle
detailedReviews.text: Cocktails were amazing. Espresso martini with tequila!! Seafood creole was great!!!

detailedReviews.author: Vickie Curry
detailedReviews.text: Why would a restaurant serve an entree on a salad plate? Flat iron steak, mashed potatoes, asperagus on a salad plate? Asked the waitress the same question and she wondered why too, but didn‚Äôt do anything about it! My Red snapper was overcooked. Birthday dinner. I‚Äôve had 63 years of better. The tanquerey martini was ok.  Thank God! Made a shitty dinner bearable! ü§™

detailedReviews.author: Natalka Kimo
detailedReviews.text:
Everything was very good, the atmosphere was perfect for a simple date night. We got the garlic spread, garlic parmesan wings, and oysters.
For dinner my boyfriend had the jambalaya and I had the Codia.

detailedReviews.author: Rik shorten
detailedReviews.text: Don‚Äôt listen to the grumpy gusses. This kitchen does amazing things. This is a special Gem in the peninsula/ Hudson area. Make reservations on weekend nights though, but othe, service and value for quality is top shelf!!

detailedReviews.author: Alex Cika
detailedReviews.text: Ate here recently and it was a pleasant experience the food was outstanding as well as the service absolutely recommended this place

detailedReviews.author: Kim Fatica
detailedReviews.text:
Glad we gave Russo‚Äôs another chance after my wife did not have a great experience here a few years back. We‚Äôve been back three times in the last year  and each time Russo‚Äôs has provided an enjoyable dining experience for us.

My wife and I like this restaurant for its food, delicious cocktails and good service. It's been a great ‚Äòre-discovery‚Äô for us and it has become our go-to restaurant when we want to have a really special dining experience.

This isn't a place where you can just show up and find a table‚Äîit's popular, so reservations are really necessary to guarantee a spot to eat.

The dishes we‚Äôve had here are delicious and in just-right proportions. We've come here with just ourselves and once with friends and have not been disappointed.

Our servers have also been an important part of our dining experience at Russo's. They've all been personable and attentive.

Russo's has two places to dine that offer two completely different experiences: the main dining room and the Bacchus Room. The main dining room has a combination of booths and tables in a carpeted area, making for a quieter atmosphere. The Bacchus Room is more of a casual sports bar type of area. It is a simple area with bare floors, standard tables, TVs with sports games on them and a bar, but also with garage doors that can open up to a patio in nicer weather.

Both areas now have the same menu. The most recent time we came we had to sit in the Bacchus Room because the main dining room was full and we could only get reservations for Bacchus. We still had excellent service and a tasty meal.

Finally, we've really enjoyed the cocktails here, especially the martinis. Great espresso martini and the sour apple has become one of my favorites.

Be prepared to pay a little more to eat here, as we have generally found entrees to be around $35 on up and cocktails were about $12, BUT...so worth it!

We look forward to returning.

detailedReviews.author: Jamal Rodgers
detailedReviews.text: The 2nd time this establishment has refused to serve my family.  The The place is racist and denied service even though we arrived early to our 6:30 appt. There were four tables including booths that were open and they lied and said they didn't have anything while whiskwhispering to each other.  They were holding tables for their white customers and since we didn't look like their ideal customer our money wasn't good enough.   On the way out there were a 630 Roberts customer that was sat immediately.  Apparently only Italians are allowed here.   Don't go here unless you are Italian or at least look like it.

detailedReviews.author: Barbara Warshaw
detailedReviews.text: Apple salad was very good. Onion soup was terrible. Very very sweet so we couldn‚Äôt eat it. Had the chicken dinner which was inedible due to how over salted it was. Very disappointing. Don‚Äôt think we will return!

detailedReviews.author: Julie Aronson
detailedReviews.text:
Excellent meal! The chef created a vegetarian pasta dish for me and it was DELICIOUS. (The regular menu is large and diverse, but not super veg-friendly.)
Give them a try!

detailedReviews.author: Taylor Swaffield
detailedReviews.text: Bad and Rude.

detailedReviews.author: Sherlock Holmes
detailedReviews.text: Is probably one of my new favorite places to go. Great food great atmosphere

detailedReviews.author: Gene White
detailedReviews.text: Limited menu butbfood was good

detailedReviews.author: Timothy Smith
detailedReviews.text: Excellent spot, some of the best food in the area! Fried pearch, oysters, absolutely incredible.

detailedReviews.author: Patrick Keating
detailedReviews.text: Had a great evening with friends. Hadn't been here in a while and seems like prices are higher and portions are smaller, but I guess that's the same everywhere. Thanks, Brandon!

detailedReviews.author: dylan shaw
detailedReviews.text: One of my favorite restaurants. The food is always amazing

detailedReviews.author: S. David Worhatch
detailedReviews.text: Treat yourself to one of Northeast Ohio's most special restaurants! Great bar with good selection and friendly patrons, but seats can be hard to come by unless you arrive early. Ample seating is available in the dining areas. The menu offerings are unsurpassed in this area. Sample the delectable pork chop entr√©e! Pasta selections are outstanding. Cavatelli and meatballs ... delicious! Scrumptious desserts offer a great way to cap a memorable experience!

detailedReviews.author: Tony Gallo
detailedReviews.text: Excellent sausage and cavatelli. Service was great.

detailedReviews.author: D Pyle
detailedReviews.text: The best pork chops and fried chicken in akron. You can sit at the bar and watch the chief's prepare the food while sipping on your favorite beverage. A must to see and taste.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Gazdecki
detailedReviews.text:
My mother and I were visiting the area to see the National Park and this restaurant came highly recommended. Russo‚Äôs exceeded our wildest expectations. The food is absolutely outstanding. Every dish we had was light, exceedingly fresh, and very generous portions. The menu offerings are unique. The balance of flavors in everything we ordered was perfect.

They have an open kitchen and you can watch as they prepare the meals. It is one of the most impressive operations I‚Äôve ever seen. Fast, efficient, and high quality all on display in a great atmosphere.

The staff at Russo‚Äôs couldn‚Äôt have been nicer. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. Lisa took care of our table. Ask for her when you visit. She‚Äôs an absolute delight.

We will definitely be visiting again next time we are in the area. We both agreed that if we lived locally we would be at Russo‚Äôs all the time. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a great night out of fine dining with good quality people.

detailedReviews.author: Tim D
detailedReviews.text: Nice atmosphere and service was good but the food is extremely mediocre and it‚Äôs very expensive for what you get.   I got cavatelli and meatballs.   The meatballs were tough and not at all tender.  The cavatellis were meh - definitely not homemade pasta and should be for that cost.  I really can‚Äôt figure out what is driving the cost for the food here. It was all very overpriced.

detailedReviews.author: Kelley C. C.
detailedReviews.text: Good food.  A little loud.

detailedReviews.author: Kasey Barnes
detailedReviews.text: Our food was out of this world, and our waitress was great!

detailedReviews.author: Tom L
detailedReviews.text: Food was very average considering the fine dining pricing...

detailedReviews.author: Michael John
detailedReviews.text:
Russo's used to be my go-to recommendation to everyone for the best Creole experience in the area. Unfortunately, things have changed.

The images attached are their carryout orders of gumbo and jambalaya. The gumbo, in the bowl, was the LARGE serving for a charge of $15. The other container was the jambalaya at a whopping charge of $25. Russo's should be embarrassed to charge these prices for this serving size.

The gumbo lacked the depth of flavor it had in the past and the jambalaya rice was way overcooked.

Avoid unless you have money to burn.

detailedReviews.author: Missa
detailedReviews.text: Probably the best restaurant we have tried since moving to the area. Everything had a cajun twist and was delicious. We will definitely be back! We recommend the raw oysters, shrimp appetizer, seafood fettuccine, chocolate torte and peanut butter chocolate pie.

detailedReviews.author: Carrie Stratmeister
detailedReviews.text:
Fantastic food, drinks & service!
We shared / sampled many appetizers and main dishes as a party of 8.
Check out their website menus.
Great variety ~ something for everyone!

detailedReviews.author: Eugene Hanz
detailedReviews.text:
Great spot for a great dinner. Check out the menu.
Awesome mussels!!
Will return soon.

detailedReviews.author: Michele Maas
detailedReviews.text: We had a fun night with friends celebrating Fat Tuesday! Really good hurricanes and delicious Cajun food and great service!

detailedReviews.author: Jim Saiko
detailedReviews.text: Great place, great atmosphere, amazing food!!!  A must try!!!  You MUST get the gumbo, and their fried chicken is the best on this planet!!!  Lisa is an AMAZING server!!!

detailedReviews.author: Rob Wright
detailedReviews.text: Fun place.  Unfortunately they ran out of certain entrees and only informed us after we ordered.  Both kitchen and bar service were slow.

detailedReviews.author: Roger Berg
detailedReviews.text: First time there I had no complaints Waitress was great

detailedReviews.author: Victoria O'Donnell
detailedReviews.text: Great food & service

detailedReviews.author: Ryan Mueller
detailedReviews.text: What a great experience!  We sat at the bar, Kristin served up some tasty cocktails and recommended the calamari, It was excellent.  We ordered a steak & the smoked Mac, amazing flavor cooked to perfect med-rare.  My wife ordered the Navajo Tacos, they were amazing! The rest of our party all enjoyed their meals as well! Highly recommend!!

detailedReviews.author: Alan Smith
detailedReviews.text: Very nice dining experience. We enjoyed the Expresso Martini's as well. Thanks guys, we'll be back soon!!

detailedReviews.author: Carla Hodge
detailedReviews.text: Attended a private party and service, drinks and food was amazing!!

detailedReviews.author: Richard Newberger
detailedReviews.text: Great good. Great service. Good wine list

detailedReviews.author: Gregory Urchek
detailedReviews.text: Delicious food! Fresh and flavorful. Service was friendly and attentive.

detailedReviews.author: Wendy Hurd
detailedReviews.text: Always a great meal and fun foods to try!  We will be back!

detailedReviews.author: Joe Jurczyk
detailedReviews.text: Great meals with Cajun cuisine!

detailedReviews.author: J B
detailedReviews.text: Upon making a reservation tonight and reviewing the Google reviews......  I'm now finally going to review Russo's...  I've been a frequent-regular at Russo's for 20+ years.  This is my destination for great food.  With this being said, you have to understand that it's operated and changed through the various lives of its owners.  I love this place and it's food.  I'm headed there tonight for my 15 anniversary with my partner and best friend.  Okra is available!  We're in!  Joshua

detailedReviews.author: brian mcfly mcfearin
detailedReviews.text:
Gourmet attitude and exceptional sauces but $24 for chicken fried steak? Small portions.
Seriously cannot believe all the 5-star ratings
This is an older crowd like me, who can afford it, but am not taking the grandkids. BTW excellent martinis and all-pro bar staff.
The menu can be ‚Äúmuddy‚Äù mix between creole/Cajun and Italian.
Fun for Fat Tuesdays and date night.
Country club crowd and I understand the business model. I would do the same thing  :-).

detailedReviews.author: Tom
detailedReviews.text:
(9-2023 Update) What COVID? Russo's is back to its normal self. Workers, although some new, are doing well. Place can get bust around 7pm, so make a RESERVATION please. Chef is consistent & does a great job. (8-2022 Update)  The place is back to near normal, with the newer workers.  Ask for prices before you order anything special. Ask for John the bartender, he will make you the best drinks anywhere - a real Gray-Beard at work (*with utmost respect).
(5-22 Update)- Russo's has lost some talent (Sheela, and perhaps others). Good/ tanlented People make Russo's. Hope to see some new/ good talent soon - did not see it today. Took away a star today.
(3-22 Update)- Nice to see Russo's returning back to pre-COVID ambience.  Prices seem a bit higher,  but that's expected  - thanks Brandon.
<Previous Review>Russo's has survived the pandemic,  and slowly returning back. Food + Margarita was good.. expensive, but worth it. Place is bigger than what you see from the street. Menu changes at times, but always good. Call ahead and make a reservation to play it safe. Well stocked bar, ask for your preferred drink, regardless if it is not on the menu.
May 2023 -be at peace, Russo's is back to its full glory after the COVID fiasco...all is good here.

detailedReviews.author: Derek McCormick
detailedReviews.text: What an amazing experience! We had dinner Saturday evening at the bar. Didn't have reservations so the bar is where we ate which turned out to be very entertaining as they cook right in front of you. After seeing how great everything looked we knew we came to the right place. Our food was cooked to perfection. Can't wait to go back. Thanks Russo's for the perfect evening!

detailedReviews.author: Laura Beaver
detailedReviews.text: On Facebook you listed a new menu item of chicken Marcella, Very disappointed as we came for this and we were told it‚Äôs not on the menu even though you posted it‚Äôs new on the menu. ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.4/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the quality and deliciousness of the food, with dishes like shrimp scampi and jambalaya being highlighted as particularly flavorful. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The restaurant offers a unique dining experience with live music and entertainment on weekends, enhancing the ambiance and making visits memorable. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The menu is dynamic and changes regularly, offering a fresh experience with each visit. - Boostly marketing services can amplify this
improvementOpportunities: Inconsistent and false advertising of menu items and specials (e.g., special drink prices, live music, grilled oysters not available as advertised) - social media marketing can improve this area
Negative reviews and reputation issues, including accusations of racism and poor service experiences - review management can address this concern
High pricing concerns without perceived value (e.g., small portion sizes, mediocre food quality) - SEO services can solve this visibility issue

I really can‚Äôt figure out what is driving the cost for the food here. It was all very overpriced.

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
